titleStmt.title: Virginia's cure, or, An advisive narrative concerning Virginia discovering the true ground of that churches unhappiness, and the only true remedy : as it was presented to the Right Reverend Father in God Gvilbert Lord Bishop of London, September 2, 1661 : now publish'd to further the welfare of that and the like plantations / by R. G.
titleStmt.author: R. G.
Gray, Robert, 16th/17th cent.
Greene, Robert, 17th cent.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by W. Godbid for Henry Brome ...,

notesStmt.note: R. G. is determined to be Robert Gray by Wing and noted with a question mark by B.M. Sabin states R. G. was probably Robert Greene, a clergyman in Virginia and cites E. D. Neill, "Notes on the Virginia colonial clergy," 1877, p. 18. However, most sources, including B.M. and Sabin, list the work under G. R.
